meanings.sent1: The workers had to manhandle the heavy boxes onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: Please do not manhandle the fragile equipment; it needs to be handled gently.
meanings.sent3: Trying to manhandle the stubborn zipper on my jacket only made it more stuck.
meanings.sent4: She felt like life was trying to manhandle her into a direction she didn't want to go.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler was able to manhandle his opponent with ease, showcasing his strength.

meanings.definition: To move or control with force or violence
meanings.sent1: The security guard had to manhandle the unruly customer out of the store.
meanings.sent2: The dictator would often manhandle his citizens to maintain control over them.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the villain tried to manhandle the hero, but justice prevailed in the end.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to manhandle everything in its path, leaving destruction behind.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed against the shore, appearing to manhandle the rocks with their power.
